question: Which waterbody was the location of the “Mayotte seismic event of 11 November 2018”?
explanation: The Mayotte seismic event of 11 November 2018 is a seismic event of unknown origin that occurred off the coast of Mayotte, an overseas department and region of France in the Indian Ocean. Though the seismic event was recorded by the seismograms of many countries such as Kenya, Chile, New Zealand, Canada, and Hawaii, it was felt by none. The seismic waves lasted for over 20 minutes. The cause of the event and tremors was identified in May 2019, when an 800-meter high undersea volcano was found that was not there before.
